intro: Libanotis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy libanotis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its medicinal and ornamental plants. Libanotis pubescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in arid conditions.
